title: Patrick of Ireland
description: The patron saint of Ireland who brought Christianity to the Emerald Isle.

title: Joan of Arc
description: A young French heroine who led armies and was later canonized as a Roman Catholic saint.

title: Pier Giorgio Frassati
description: An Italian Catholic activist known for his dedication to social justice and his joyful spirit.

title: Francis of Assisi
description: The founder of the Franciscan Order, known for his love of nature and animals.

title: Carlo Acutis
description: A young Italian programmer beatified for his use of technology to spread the faith.

title: JP2 - Karol Wojtyla
description: Pope John Paul II, one of the most influential popes in modern history.

title: St. Benedict
description: The founder of Western monasticism and author of the Rule of Saint Benedict.

title: Juan Diego
description: The first Roman Catholic indigenous saint from the Americas, associated with Our Lady of Guadalupe.

title: Kateri Tekakwitha
description: The first North American indigenous person to be canonized by the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Isaac Jogues
description: A French Jesuit priest and missionary martyr in North America.

title: Saint George
description: A Roman soldier venerated as a Christian martyr, often depicted slaying a dragon.

title: Elizabeth Ann Seton
description: The first native-born citizen of the United States to be canonized by the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Josephine Bakhita
description: A Sudanese-Italian former slave who became a Roman Catholic saint.

title: Saint Valentine
description: A 3rd-century Roman saint associated with courtly love and affection.

title: Damien of Molokai
description: A Belgian priest who ministered to people with leprosy in Hawaii.

title: Bernadette of Lourdes
description: A young French girl known for Marian apparitions at Lourdes.

title: Frances Xavier Cabrini
description: The first United States citizen to be canonized, known for her work with Italian immigrants.

title: John Bosco
description: An Italian priest who dedicated his life to the betterment and education of street children.

title: Edith Stein
description: A German Jewish philosopher who converted to Catholicism and became a Carmelite nun.

title: Paul Miki
description: A Japanese Jesuit seminarian who was martyred for his faith.

title: Stanley Rother
description: An American priest and martyr who served in Guatemala.

title: Clare of Assisi
description: The founder of the Order of Poor Ladies, a monastic religious order for women.

title: Dymphna
description: An Irish saint associated with mental health and nervous system disorders.

title: Gianna Molla
description: An Italian pediatrician canonized for refusing abortion when pregnant with her fourth child.

title: Saint Charbel
description: A Maronite monk and priest from Lebanon known for his devotion and miracles.

title: Junipero Serra
description: A Spanish Franciscan friar who founded missions in California.

title: Moses the Black
description: An Ethiopian desert monk known for his conversion from a life of crime.

title: Philip Howard
description: An English nobleman who became a Catholic martyr during the reign of Elizabeth I.

title: Genesius
description: A Roman actor who converted to Christianity while performing a satirical play about Christian rites.

title: Maximilian Kolbe
description: A Polish Franciscan friar who volunteered to die in place of a stranger in Auschwitz.

title: Our Lady of Fatima
description: A Marian apparition reported by three shepherd children in Fatima, Portugal.

title: Josemaria Escriva
description: A Spanish priest who founded Opus Dei, an organization of laypeople and priests.

title: Katharine Drexel
description: An American heiress who became a Roman Catholic nun and founded the Sisters of the Blessed Sacrament.

title: Thomas More
description: An English lawyer, statesman, and martyr who opposed Henry VIII's separation from the Catholic Church.

title: Perpetua and Felicity
description: Christian martyrs of the 3rd century who were put to death in Roman Carthage.

title: John Vianney
description: A French parish priest known for his priestly and pastoral work in his parish of Ars.

title: Therese of Lisieux
description: A French Carmelite nun known for her 'little way' of holiness in everyday life.

title: Augustine
description: An early Christian theologian and philosopher whose writings influenced Western Christianity.

title: Teresa of Avila
description: A Spanish mystic, Carmelite nun, and reformer known for her spiritual writings.
